title: Will I be wasting my brilliance if I choose a BBA after 12th science with biology, maths, chemistry, and physics? I’m a pretty above average student. What should I do? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi Thehzin, At the cost of sounding blunt, its too early to rate yourself as above average, when your competition at this stage if largely limited to students in your school/state since you have not even appeared for class 12th. Let time decide thatGetting into Shahid Sukhdev College of Business Studies, probably the best ranked BMS college in the country can be as much, if not more challenging that getting into many engineering colleges. So, don’t demean BMS program over Engineering, if you have any thoughts of doing soIf your interest is engineering, pursue it. Don’t switch to BMS studies, unless your academic interest changes. Getting into BMS right now makes sense only if you have decided to pursue MBA in future & don’t wish to join engineering/medicine, in spite of your science background (Which is perfectly ok). I have met many BMS graduates, way smarter & intelligent that many engineersYour smartness will be further tested when you compete with CAT/GMAT/MS aspirants who wish to get into top b-schools/engineering programs in India and abroad, irrespective of whether you do engineering or BMS. So, you have way to go before your brilliance is truly tested.As of now, just make an informed decision about your academic stream & keep working for next 2–3 years at a time. All the best

I don't what BBA exactly is apart from the fact that it's business related course, but I can say with good confidence that someone who's smart enough and can think originally can bring a a lot of good things to the table, especially in the business you'll have lot of freedom & even requirement to innovate. If you like the field, then you should go for it don't let the opinions of ignorant people outside effect your career choices.

If your interest is in BBA pursue it if you did not like the science option after that you can also go for MBA through IIMS and I don’t think getting into IIMs is a small achievement So, It depends more on you rather than degree That’s it All the best for your future Stay Home , Stay Safe
